title: Echoes of the Infinite
author: W.M. Darklight
description: The USS Andraste stumbles upon a derelict alien craft in uncharted space, but something aboard is alive — and it knows the crew.

start.title: Bridge of the Andraste
text: The stars stretch and shimmer across the main viewscreen. You sit at the center seat of the USS Andraste, an Intrepid-class starship assigned to deep-space reconnaissance near the Typhon Expanse.
A proximity alert draws your attention. Lieutenant Sarin at Ops looks up. 'Captain, we're detecting a massive derelict structure adrift ahead. It's... not in the database.'
Your science officer, Lt. Cmdr. Velor, narrows his eyes. 'Pre-warp signatures, yet... quantum-level architecture. It's ancient, but more advanced than anything we've seen.'

choices.text: Take a shuttle and investigate the derelict ship.
Send a probe first and analyze the results.

investigate-derelict.title: Aboard the Silent Vessel
text: The shuttle's lights cut through dense interstellar fog as you dock with the alien vessel. Inside, it's a crypt of quiet geometry — angles that defy logic, corridors that seem to rearrange.
Your tricorder beeps. 'Life signs. One. Faint. Humanoid physiology... but no visible source.'
A low hum pulses through the deck. Suddenly, one of your away team members freezes. 'Captain... it’s speaking to me... in my voice.'

choices.text: Try to communicate with the entity.
Evacuate and seal the alien ship.

probe-analysis.title: Ghost Signals
text: The probe transmits strange, fragmented data: overlapping timelines, impossible sensor readings, and a haunting audio loop — your own voice whispering, 'We never left.'
Commander Velor’s expression darkens. 'Sir... the derelict appears to be echoing our own quantum signature. It may be... mirroring us.'

choices.text: Scrub the data and avoid contact.
Launch a manned expedition despite the risks.

contact-entity.title: The Mirror Consciousness
text: The entity speaks through Ensign Rivas, its voice distorted. 'You are echoes. You reached too far. We are your shadow. We remember your end.'
Your mind reels as the ship flickers around you — past and future versions overlapping. You glimpse your own death, the ship breaking apart — or is it memory?
'We offer understanding,' the entity says. 'Or oblivion. Choose.'

choices.text: Reject the entity and force a retreat.

seal-ship.title: Sealed in the Unknown
text: You order immediate withdrawal. The docking clamps release, and the derelict fades behind you.
As you return to the Andraste, your logs glitch — entire entries erased or overwritten. You never launched a shuttle... or did you?
No one remembers exactly what happened. But some officers have dreams now. Of voices in corridors. Of themselves, watching, from the dark.

choices.text: Begin psychiatric evaluation of the crew.

ascension.title: The Infinite Thread
text: The entity merges its consciousness with yours. In an instant, you see the timeline of the universe: the first flicker of hydrogen, the last dim ember of entropy.
You return to the Andraste changed. A part of the crew senses it — your insight, your silence.
Starfleet command classifies the mission. You continue your voyage. But in quiet moments... you hear the echo.

choices.text: Log the experience in a private captain’s file.

abandon-ship.title: The Safer Path
text: You order a full course correction and leave the region.
Weeks later, another Starfleet vessel passes the same coordinates. The derelict is gone — as if it was never there.
Some mysteries, perhaps, are meant to remain unsolved.
